snippet.textDisplay: Hey everyone, a have a tip for anyone out there who is planning to sew masks. I did some research and found adding HEPA vacuum filters may help to improve the effectiveness of these hand-sewn masks.  I've joined an online community that is making masks for local hospitals and medical facilities. They have been linking up information about how to sew masks with the filters in. If you go online and do some research you should be able to find information about it.   Anyway, best of luck with your sewing and a special thank you to those of you working in the medical field and to those of you sewing masks or trying in some other ways to make a difference in all this.  Thanks for this tutorial! Easy to understand.
snippet.textOriginal: Hey everyone, a have a tip for anyone out there who is planning to sew masks. I did some research and found adding HEPA vacuum filters may help to improve the effectiveness of these hand-sewn masks.  I've joined an online community that is making masks for local hospitals and medical facilities. They have been linking up information about how to sew masks with the filters in. If you go online and do some research you should be able to find information about it.   Anyway, best of luck with your sewing and a special thank you to those of you working in the medical field and to those of you sewing masks or trying in some other ways to make a difference in all this.  Thanks for this tutorial! Easy to understand.

snippet.textDisplay: I appreciate ur video and my opinion is only just that. I have been making hundreds of these in the past 2 weeks as well as wearing them. I think the flannel would make these too hot to wear. I use 2 pieces of fabric and make three pleats and after wearing it for fifteen or so min it gets pretty warm on the face. Just a little opinion, no criticism. I hate when ppl don’t appreciate the help all u wonderful YouTube video makers contribute. Thank you

snippet.textDisplay: THE NURSES ARE SAYING PLEASE DO NOT USE FLANNEL, IT'S TOO HOT! A standard size cotton pillow case will yield 18 - 6" x 9" sheets for a thin, light weight interior layer for added protection. A great way to put those aging sheets to good use!

snippet.textDisplay: To add a twist tie to pinch across the bridge of the nose, insert a twist tie at least 3" long before you turn it right side out. Center it in the seam allowance and zigzag over it to hold it in place. Be careful  not to hit it with your needle. You may need to adjust your stitch width for this. You only need to zigzag the length of the twist tie. Then turn the piece right side out and  continue with making your pleats. When sewing around the edges just sew a little closer to the edge where the twist tie is so you dont hit it with the needle.
snippet.textOriginal: To add a twist tie to pinch across the bridge of the nose, insert a twist tie at least 3" long before you turn it right side out. Center it in the seam allowance and zigzag over it to hold it in place. Be careful  not to hit it with your needle. You may need to adjust your stitch width for this. You only need to zigzag the length of the twist tie. Then turn the piece right side out and  continue with making your pleats. When sewing around the edges just sew a little closer to the edge where the twist tie is so you dont hit it with the needle.

snippet.textDisplay:
Love that people are doing what they can to help out, but I just read a study that compared fabric masks against medical ones across 16 hospitals, and they determined that they're not very effective.
Double layer cloth masks still allowed 95% of particles through, and once they get damp could actually be worse.
Although, the study wasn't able to test whether a cloth mask was better than nothing at all. If anything, you can make a cute mask that at the very least, helps remind you to not touch your face. lol
snippet.textOriginal:
Love that people are doing what they can to help out, but I just read a study that compared fabric masks against medical ones across 16 hospitals, and they determined that they're not very effective. 
Double layer cloth masks still allowed 95% of particles through, and once they get damp could actually be worse. 
Although, the study wasn't able to test whether a cloth mask was better than nothing at all. If anything, you can make a cute mask that at the very least, helps remind you to not touch your face. lol

snippet.textDisplay: Hint . After you make mask take 3 -4 coffee filters and trim to fit inside mask . Make a iodine alcohol solution ( 3 drops / 100 ml ) and spray one filter . Let dry overnight . Place the treated one in mask first  ,add the other two or three plain filters . Now you have a better barrier to collect particles . After use dispose of filters ,wash mask and repeat for another day . 🙂
snippet.textOriginal: Hint . After you make mask take 3 -4 coffee filters and trim to fit inside mask . Make a iodine alcohol solution ( 3 drops / 100 ml ) and spray one filter . Let dry overnight . Place the treated one in mask first  ,add the other two or three plain filters . Now you have a better barrier to collect particles . After use dispose of filters ,wash mask and repeat for another day . 🙂

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks 🙏🏼
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks 🙏🏼

snippet.textDisplay:
Since the point is to avoid droplets getting through the mask...
1. Can you use table cloths (vinyl, plastic or whatever that material is called that causes liquids to bead up) as either the main piece of fabric or the insert?

2. Can you cover either piece with a thin layer of glue (wood, felt, stitch etc)?

3. Can you use plastic shopping bags or Ziploc bags instead of flannel for the middle? The mask isn't airtight so the plastic shouldn't interfere with breathing.
snippet.textOriginal:
Since the point is to avoid droplets getting through the mask...
1. Can you use table cloths (vinyl, plastic or whatever that material is called that causes liquids to bead up) as either the main piece of fabric or the insert?

2. Can you cover either piece with a thin layer of glue (wood, felt, stitch etc)?

3. Can you use plastic shopping bags or Ziploc bags instead of flannel for the middle? The mask isn't airtight so the plastic shouldn't interfere with breathing.
